Model.Game

Class Pool

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.Game.Pool

  • public class Pool
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the pool where all Tiles are drawn from. Every Tile used in the game originally came from this class. Created by Martijn on 12-1-2016.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.List<Tile> pool
      The actual list of Tiles that are still contained in the pool.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pool()
      Creates a new instance of Pool with Configuration.RANGE * Configuration.RANGE unique tiles.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Tile> getPool()
      Returns the actual list of Tiles contained in this pool.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks whether pool is empty.
      java.util.List<Tile> takeTiles(int amount)
      Takes a specified amount of tiles out of the pool.
      java.util.List<Tile> tradeTiles(java.util.List<Tile> oldTiles)
      Trades the oldTiles with random tiles from the pool.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • pool

        private java.util.List<Tile> pool
        The actual list of Tiles that are still contained in the pool.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pool

        public Pool()
        Creates a new instance of Pool with Configuration.RANGE * Configuration.RANGE unique tiles. Every unique tile appears Configuration.TILE_DUPLICATES times in the pool.

    • Method Detail

      • getPool

        public java.util.List<Tile> getPool()
        Returns the actual list of Tiles contained in this pool.
        Returns:
        The pool.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks whether pool is empty.
        Returns:
        True if pool has no Tiles left.

      • takeTiles

        public java.util.List<Tile> takeTiles(int amount)
                               throws InsufficientTilesInPoolException
        Takes a specified amount of tiles out of the pool. The amount must be between 0 (exclusive) and Configuration.MAXIMUM_HAND (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        amount - tiles taken from the pool
        Returns:
        a List of Tiles
        Throws:
        InsufficientTilesInPoolException - If the pool doesn't have enough tiles to take

      • tradeTiles

        public java.util.List<Tile> tradeTiles(java.util.List<Tile> oldTiles)
                                throws InsufficientTilesInPoolException
        Trades the oldTiles with random tiles from the pool.
        Parameters:
        oldTiles - Tiles to be traded
        Returns:
        a List of new Tiles from the pool
        Throws:
        InsufficientTilesInPoolException - If the pool doesn't have enough tiles to trade
